meanings.definition: Resembling a twit in behavior or character.
meanings.sent1: Her twittish remarks made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent2: He always acts twittish when he's nervous.
meanings.sent3: The cat's twittish behavior chasing its tail was quite amusing.
meanings.sent4: The twittish squirrel kept forgetting where it buried its nuts.
meanings.sent5: The twittish clown's antics were unforgettable at the party.

meanings.sent1: Don't be twittish and make silly mistakes.
meanings.sent2: She felt twittish wearing mismatched socks to work.
meanings.sent3: His twittish decision to wear shorts in the snow was comical.
meanings.sent4: The twittish puppy kept chasing its own shadow.
meanings.sent5: The twittish student's pranks always brought laughter to the classroom.

meanings.definition: Showing a lack of intelligence or common sense.
meanings.sent1: Ignoring safety warnings is a twittish thing to do.
meanings.sent2: The twittish driver tried to fill his car with cooking oil.
meanings.sent3: His twittish idea to use a rake as a paddle failed miserably.
meanings.sent4: The twittish bird built its nest in the path of a lawnmower.
meanings.sent5: The twittish explorer got lost in his own backyard.
